intro: Borreria, commonly known as Mexican tea or desert hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It consists of approximately 100 species, predominantly found in arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas. The plants are shrubs or small trees with woody stems and showy, often pink or red flowers. They have hairy, narrow leaves and produce capsule fruits containing numerous small seeds. Borreria species are adapted to harsh environments, making them resilient and drought-tolerant.
